etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Nature: a weekly journal of science. From rota- + -meter

definitions: An apparatus for demonstrating the circular motion of the planets. rare.

notes.text: This apparatus was devised by Henry Perigal (1801–98), amateur mathematician, probably in connection with his views on the motion of the moon about the earth as rotation or revolution.

definitions: Also with capital initial. A device with a transparent wall that can be fitted into a pipe or tube to indicate the rate of flow of fluid passing along it.

notes.text: A trademark in the United Kingdom.
